Teacher Li's Weibo is hot and the Cyber Parade has started again. 
And I personally feel that the biggest difference from the day of secretly enjoying the party is that many people in the real-time account this time are describing their experience of being a little pink three years ago. . . They are not the kind of people who are grateful for having food to eat!! 
It feels like they are regretting it very seriously. . . It takes more than ten years to train a rabbit, but it may take only a few months or even one night for a rabbit to become a god. . .

content:
A picture widely circulated in the circle of friends tonight:
In Urumqi, Xinjiang, a child needs to go to Beijing for surgery, but he has not been able to obtain the entry documents. It has been delayed since October 5th. I wanted to call to report it, but found that all the calls were unreachable.
If it is delayed any further, the child will be doomed

name: æè€å¸ˆä¸æ˜¯ä½ è€å¸ˆ
content: Those who are complaining about what to do with the elderly and children have overlooked one point. China's medical resources are extremely unbalanced. Many diseases can only be treated in big cities, while some diseases can only be treated in Beijing and Shanghai. The zero-COVID lockdown has cut off the wages of the families of these elderly and children, and also cut off their access to medical care, which is basically a death sentence for them. Not to mention that there are many diseases that require going to the hospital every day or every two days.

name: æè€å¸ˆä¸æ˜¯ä½ è€å¸ˆ
content: Are there any arrangements and plans for these people? I think there must be, but in the face of absolute epidemic prevention, ordinary people donâ€™t care about their lives at all. Therefore, we see that the elderly die at the door of the hospital, pregnant women give birth at the door of the hospital, and parents kneel and kowtow at the door of the childrenâ€™s hospital. Why? Just because of the nucleic acid test, they are not allowed to enter the hospital.

name: æè€å¸ˆä¸æ˜¯ä½ è€å¸ˆ
content:
So I have been saying that the so-called "people first", the so-called "for the elderly and children", and the so-called "for the safety of the lives of the general public" are all lies. The lockdown is just for political achievements, nothing more.
If the standard for evaluating political achievements tomorrow becomes who has the most Chinese people, then these officials will immediately and ruthlessly take action. It's that simple.

name: æè€å¸ˆä¸æ˜¯ä½ è€å¸ˆ
content: It is speechless. How will their children feel when they see the video and their parents kneeling on the ground?

name: æè€å¸ˆä¸æ˜¯ä½ è€å¸ˆ
content:
Once you understand that children are hostages in this country, it is not surprising that those parents kneel down.
What else can parents do besides kneeling down? If they are a little impulsive, their children will not be able to go to key schools in the future, and all their hard work will go to waste.
They don't even have the slightest bargaining power in front of the government. They can only kneel down and kowtow to beg for mercy to ensure the safety of their children to the minimum extent.
1/2

name: æè€å¸ˆä¸æ˜¯ä½ è€å¸ˆ
content:
But they will eventually understand that kneeling and kowtow is useless. Requests made under the premise of losing one's own dignity are just a joke.
How do children feel when they see their parents kneeling in front of the people-friendly government and police in the books? Will they still believe in the content of the books? Are they still willing to stay in their hometown? When they leave their hometown and find that other places are the same, will they still trust this land?
